parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Vainglorious, boastful. From kenos and doxa; vainly glorifying, i.e. Self-conceited.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To provoke, stimulate, challenge, call out. Middle voice from pro and kaleo; to call forth to oneself, i.e. to irritate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To envy. From phthonos; to be jealous of.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
